hypothesis_content.title: BTC ETF Outflow Shock Triggers Cross-Asset De-risking Cascade
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BEAR or STRESS regime, an unexpectedly large single-day net outflow (>$500M) from US Spot Bitcoin ETFs will act as a confirming signal, amplifying selling pressure across the entire crypto complex. This will manifest as BTC breaking a key technical support level (e.g., prior weekly low) and triggering a correlated, accelerated drop in the TOTAL3 index (altcoin market cap ex-BTC, ETH) within the same trading session.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large ETF outflows in a bear regime validate institutional selling pressure, a powerful narrative. This erodes a key price support thesis (institutional demand). The break of technical support triggers systematic and stop-loss selling in BTC, which then cascades into the less liquid altcoin market as portfolio managers de-risk holistically.
entry_conditions: 8:00 AM ET ETF flow data shows net outflow > $500M.
BTC price in pre-market (9:30 AM ET) trades below the previous day's low.
TOTAL3/BTC ratio begins to decline within the first 2 hours of US equity open, indicating altcoin underperformance.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Short TOTAL3 via basket or futures: 5% move in favor.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: If BTC reclaims the broken support level (previous day's low) and holds for 2 consecutive hours.
exit_conditions.time_exit: End of the US trading session (4:00 PM ET).

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A large outflow occurs, but BTC price remains stable or rallies, absorbing the selling without breaking support, indicating strong underlying bid elsewhere.
